event.summary: 03/11/193: Muslim militants threw a gasoline bomb at a police patrol in retaliation for police raids on extremists. The attack occurred in Aswan, 615 miles south of Cairo. No injuries or casualties resulted from the incident.
event.motive: The attack may have been in retaliation for a government raid on fundamentalists the day before.
event.addnotes: Police raids on Tuesday night and Wednesday resulted in the death of 14 extremists, a militant's wife and her baby and four police officers. More than 40 people were wounded. The attack on police may have been retaliation for the police raids. No injuries or casualties resulted from the attack. Another attack on police occurred in Sohag, see event ID 199303110001 for more information.
event.scite1: “Egyptian Officer Dies; Radicals Are Blamed,” The New York Times, March 12, 1993.
event.scite2: Zina Hemady, “Muslim Extremists Strike Back at Police Crackdown in Egypt,” The Associated Press, March 11, 1993.
